column2: When I work in a group I do higher quality work.
column3: When I work in a group, I end up doing most of the work.
column4: My group members help explain things that I do not understand.
column5: When I work in a group, I am able to share my ideas.
column6: My group members make me feel that I am not as smart as they are.
column7: The material is easier to understand when I work with other students.
column8: The workload is usually less when I work with other students.
column9: My group members respect my opinions.
column10: I feel I am part of what is going on in the group.
column11: I do not think a group grade is fair.
column12: I try to make sure my group members learn the material.
column13: I learn to work with students who are different from me.
column14: My group members do not care about my feelings.
column15: I let the other students do most of the work.
column16: I feel working in groups is a waste of time.
column17: I have to work with students who are not as smart as I am.
column18: When I work with other students the work is divided equally.
column19: We cannot complete the assignment unless everyone contributes.
column20: I also learn when I teach the material to my group members.
column21: I become frustrated when my group members do not understand the material.
column22: Everyone’s ideas are needed if we are going to be successful.
column23: When I work with other students, we spend too much time talking about other things.

Everyone’s ideas are needed if we are going to be successful.
When I work with other students, we spend too much time talking about other things.
